intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pallescentifrons, commonly known as the pale-fronted hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive pale band near the base. It is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes, making it both a common wildflower and a potential weed.
